oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Take My Hand, Precious Lord
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dorsey, Thomas A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Performing Identity
Musicians
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Thomas A. Dorsey (1899-1993), started his career as "Georgia Tom" a singer of bawdy blues songs. In the early 1930s he left the blues and jazz behind to become one of the most important authors of gospel songs. Dorsey composed familiar pieces such as "Peace in the Valley" and "Precious Lord, Take My Hand."
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Fisk University, John Hope and Aurelia E. Franklin Library, Special Collections
